thread.title: Gov. Greitens to sign right-to-work bill Monday
thread.title_full: Gov. Greitens to sign right-to-work bill Monday

title: Gov. Greitens to sign right-to-work bill Monday
text: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens delivers his first State of the State speech to the… more BILL GREENBLATT | UPI Gov. Eric Greitens is wasting no time in signing a so-called right-to-work measure passed last week by the Missouri Legislature. Greitens will hold ceremonial signings of Senate Bill 19 at 9:30 a.m. Monday at what a release from his office described as "an abandoned warehouse" in Springfield, Missouri. He will sign another copy of the bill in Poplar Bluff, Missouri, 30 minutes from the Arkansas border. Missouri Governor Eric Greitens delivers his first State of the State speech to the… more BILL GREENBLATT | UPI The governor "will declare that Missouri is open for business and that this legislation is a key part of his fight for more jobs," according to the release. A final signing will take place Monday evening at the state Capitol. The legislation will prohibit unions from requiring workers to pay dues as a condition of employment. With Greitens' signature, Missouri will become the 28th right-to-work state in the U.S. Home of the Day
